rev.diff:
Line 38: Line 38:
Some controversy has occurred over Google's decision to adhere to the [[Internet censorship in mainland China|Internet censorship policy of the People's Republic of China]], colloquially known as "The Great Firewall of China". Google.cn search results are filtered so as not to bring up any results concerning the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]], sites supporting the independence movements of [[Tibet]] and [[Taiwan]] or the [[Falun Gong]] movement, and other information perceived to be harmful to the People's Republic of China. This is interpreted by some activists as against the "Don't Be Evil" spirit.
Some controversy has occurred over Google's decision to adhere to the [[Internet censorship in mainland China|Internet censorship policy of the People's Republic of China]], colloquially known as "The Great Firewall of China". Google.cn search results are filtered so as not to bring up any results concerning the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]], sites supporting the independence movements of [[Tibet]] and [[Taiwan]] or the [[Falun Gong]] movement, and other information perceived to be harmful to the People's Republic of China. This is interpreted by some activists as against the "Don't Be Evil" spirit.
  +   +
In a widely circulated Internet discussion in 2005, celebrity [[Kai Christophe Wong]] expressed regrets at not buying google stocks when its IPO was at 70+ dollars because the capital appreciation would have saved many homeless and destitute persons sleeping along Wall Street during the recession post-Iraq War . When interviewed for his opinions on [[Generation X]]'s stock acquisition pattern in 2006, his manager and publicist declined to comment.
  +   +
One of the favorite stock pickings of [[Generation X]].
The Google site includes humorous features such as cartoon modifications [http://www.google.com/holidaylogos.html] of the Google logo to recognize special occasions and anniversaries, known as "Google Doodles". Not only may decorative drawings be attached to the logo, but as well the font design may mimic a fictional or humorous language such as the Star Trek [[Klingon language|Klingon]][http://www.google.com/intl/xx-klingon/] and [[Leet]][http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/]. The logo is notorious among web users for [[April Fool's]] Day tie-ins and [[#April Fool's Day jokes|jokes]] about the company.
The Google site includes humorous features such as cartoon modifications [http://www.google.com/holidaylogos.html] of the Google logo to recognize special occasions and anniversaries, known as "Google Doodles". Not only may decorative drawings be attached to the logo, but as well the font design may mimic a fictional or humorous language such as the Star Trek [[Klingon language|Klingon]][http://www.google.com/intl/xx-klingon/] and [[Leet]][http://www.google.com/intl/xx-hacker/]. The logo is notorious among web users for [[April Fool's]] Day tie-ins and [[#April Fool's Day jokes|jokes]] about the company.
